section.name: Building and running Apache Shindig for PHP
section.p: This is the PHP steps on how to build and run Apache Shindig.

subsection.name: Prequisites before building Apache Shindig for PHP
subsection.p: In order to build and run Apache Shindig for PHP, you must have the following:

ul.li:
A Subversion client installed in order to checkout the code.
Instructions for downloading and installing Subversion can be found here: http://subversion.tigris.org/

Apache with mod_rewrite enabled.
PHP 5.2.x with the json, simplexml, mcrypt and curl extentions enabled.

subsection.name: Getting the code
subsection.p: Create a subdirectory in your web document root, e.g. /var/www/html and checkout the Apache Shindig code from its Subversion repository

subsection.name: Running Apache Shindig
subsection.p: With PHP There is no need to build anything - the source code is already built.
To run the code, you have several options:
subsection.h4: a. Create a new virtual host
subsection.p: Point your apache to the php dir with a virtual host like:
subsection.pre:
<VirtualHost your_ip:your_port>
ServerName your.host DocumentRoot /var/www/html/shindig/php ... other normal settings in vhosts... </VirtualHost>

subsection.h4: b. Run with an existing host
subsection.p: If you cannot/don't want to create a virtual host, you can edit the file php/config.php and change the web_prefix setting to '/shindig/php'.
